HAPPY BIRTHDAY TWIST!! Have a free eBook!

Posted on November 17, 2013 by

Oh, they grow up so fast!

Well, it’s official.  My beautiful boy is 3 years old today.  Well, the series is, anyway.  Now it’s time to party!  Break out the wine!  Light the birthday candles!  Start singing out of tune!  Run in terror from the skanky clown that some idiot hired.  Put on your silly paper hats, and let’s all toast our favorite little clockmaker’s good fortune!

But best of all, it’s time to unwrap the presents!  As promised, the eBook of the Waking 2nd Edition  will be FREE all day today, on Smashwords.com

(Not Amazon.  They’re no fun.)

Go grab a shiny new copy right now!

Share the link with your loved ones!  Share it with your enemies!  Share it with your postman!  Don’t let anyone miss out.

If you’ve already got a copy of the 1st Edition, you can download the new version for free as well.  Just follow the link, then scroll down and click the “download” link for the format you’d like.  On the following page, click the link for today’s date, Nov 17th.  

If you’ve missed the party, and are reading this after the 17th, you can still get the new version for free at any point, just so long as you already bought the eBook on Smashwords.


If you bought your Kindle eBook on Amazon, you should be getting an e-mail from them soon.

Follow the instructions in their email to get the updated version.  Or you could get the Smashwords version today, as well.  Seriously, why not?

And don’t forget to submit any photos or fan-art, or anything you do to celebrate Twist’s big day!  (Comment here, Facebook, Goodreads, #CWTwist, whatever)  I’ll add everything I get to a special after-party post.  Here’s a super cute little comic strip I got just last night!  Thanks Betsy!! (click to enlarge)


Isn’t that just darling?  I also want to say thank you to everyone for celebrating with me!  This is the first year that I’ve thrown Twist much of a birthday party. I’m sure he would go bright pink with embarrassment at all of this hullabaloo.

FREE ebook, and paperback giveaway for Twist’s B-day!

Posted on October 27, 2013 by

Good news, everyone!  No, I haven’t created a new doomsday device, but I will be doing two book giveaways in November!!  As you may have read in a previous post, Twist’s birthday will be on November 17th.  What better way to celebrate than with gifts to my marvelous fans?  Well, yeah, okay.  Adorable Steampunk cupcakes are probably another great way to celebrate.  I know I want some!

Now, to book business!

The first giveaway will be on Goodreads.  I’ll be launching a new 2nd edition of Waking, with bonus content, on December 16th.  This new edition will be essentially the same as the first, but with the bonus of the first few chapters of Trick added at the back.  Because you know, Trick is coming very, very soon…  If you’ve already got your copy of Waking, don’t despair!  I’ll also be posting the same preview chapters on my site as well, starting in December.  But, If you don’t have your paperback copy yet, or you want a new shiny copy for free, go and sign up on Goodreads, starting on the 1st of November!

But wait, there’s more!  I’m also going to price the 2nd edition of the eBook for FREE all day on Twist’s birthday, the 17th.  The content of the eBook 2nd edition will be the same as a the paperback, complete with the new chapters.  And best of all, if you already have a copy of the eBook, you’ll be able to download the new version for FREE!   I’ll give instructions when the days get closer, so keep an eye on the blog/facebook/twitter/tumblr/whatever!

To some up, here are the dates to add you your calendar:

  • Nov 1st – Nov 30th, Paperback giveaway sign up.
  • Nov 17th – Twist is 3 years old!!  And, free eBook all day!
  • Dec 15th, 2nd edition of Waking launched, and the first preview chapter of Trick posted on the site.

Oh, I’m so excited!

As if that wasn’t enough all ready, I’m also going to make an appearance at a local Author Fair, this Saturday.  If you’re in the San Jose area, come say hi!  And find out what other literary gems Silicon Valley is hiding…

Suggested Reading: Edgar Allen Poe, The Cask of Amontillado

Posted on October 20, 2013 by

With the coming ghouls and ghosties, that new chill in the air, pumpkin flavored everything, and nature dressed all in her best colors, I thought that this month I’d give you a truly creepy tale from the grand master of horror himself.  But when I looked at the sheer number of amazing stories on offer, I was overwhelmed.  How do you pick ONE great story out of so many?  Then, I remembered my very favorite story by our lovely Poe.

“For the love of God, Montresor…!!”  Ah!  Wonderful.  It’s got costumes, dark catacombs, and murderous intent.  Perfect for Halloween!  Sure, it might not be the scariest Poe story, but I think it’s one of the very best.  If you’ve never read it, you must read it this instant!  If you have read it before, wallow in the nostalgic awesome with me.

This was actually the first Poe story that I ever read myself, when I was about 12 or 13.  If I’m perfectly honest, reading these masterful, dreadful, brilliant words had a huge influence on me.  Young little me, my eyes alight with true wonder, vowed that day to write something even half as good, even if it took the rest of my life.  And I’m still striving for that same goal today.  Enjoy!

THE CASK OF AMONTILLADO
by Edgar Allan Poe
